statement.p: Guido is flying east at 11500 MSL using the local altimeter setting of 28.83 inHg. In the lower atmosphere the pressure drops approximately 1 inHg per 1000 feet of elevation gained.
How much does the pressure drop from the ground (0 MSL) to 11500 ft above? inHg
If the pressure is 28.83 inHg at 0 MSL, what is the pressure at 11500 ft MSL? inHg

solution.p: Because this is a drop in pressure, the expected pressure is \displaystyle{P}={28.83}\ \text{ inHg}-{11.5}\ \text{ inHg}={17.33}\ \text{ inHg}.
